cmp: 乙 ("B" (in a sequence of examples involving "A", "B", "C", etc.)/2nd heavenly stem/2nd in order)
mng: dry, clean, in vain, dried food, foster, adoptive, to ignore
one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing heaven, male principle, ☰, ancient Chinese compass point: 315° (northwest)

exm.mng: Heaven and earth, Yin and Yang, The Universe
dry and rough (skin), hoarse (voice), dry and heavy (style)
straightforward, clear-cut, blunt (e.g. statement), you might as well, simply
to dry (of weather, paint, cement etc), desiccation, dull, uninteresting, arid
Qianlong or Ch'ien-lung, emperor of the Qing dynasty, reigned sixty years (1735-1796)
to drink a toast, Cheers! (proposing a toast), Here's to you!, Bottoms up!, lit. dry cup
